articles.content: The rescuers found the deceased skiers under several feet of snow. | Image: CNSAS Alto Adige Two Finnish tourists have died after being buried in an avalanche on Thursday afternoon, February 5, in Sulden (Solda) in South Tyrol in northern Italy. The incident occurred around 1:30 p.m. on a freeride slope below the Schöntaufspitze (Punta Beltovo), which can be reached by the Rosim gondola. The avalanche extended toward Rosimtal (Val di Rosim), a high alpine valley and popular freeride zone in the Sulden (Solda) ski area. articles.title: This Japanese Ski Resort Has A Karaoke Gondola Cabin
articles.description: Skiers and snowboarders at Hakuba Goryu Snow Resort in Japan can sing karaoke while riding up the mountain.
articles.content: Anyone who visits Japan, whether it’s just for sightseeing or for skiing/snowboarding, needs to do some karaoke. In the U.S., most karaoke is done in a bar with everyone watching. In Japan, most karaoke is done in private rooms for just you and your friends. It really takes things to the next level. Skiers and snowboarders at Hakuba Goryu Snow Resort in Japan don’t need to go far out of their way to get some karaoke in. In fact if they wind up on the resort’s #55 gondola cabin, they can sing karaoke while riding up the mountain. View this post on Instagram A post shared by 白馬五竜 : エイブル白馬五竜 ABLE Hakuba Goryu / 白馬五竜高山植物園 (@hakubagoryuofficial) The karaoke gondola celebrates the ski area’s 55th season in operation. As the 55th gondola cabin, it has a fancy warp on the outside and a party on the inside. Certainly quite the way to celebrate a birthday! articles.title: Two New 6-Seater Chairlifts Open In Dachstein-West
articles.content: With the grand opening of the two new 6-seater chairlifts, Aussichtsberg and Angeralm, the Dachstein West ski region has reached another significant milestone in its tourism development. The two new lifts connect the ski resorts in Gosau (Upper Austria) and Annaberg (Salzburg) and thus serve as a powerful symbol of cross-border cooperation in alpine tourism. Since their commissioning last December, they have noticeably improved traffic flow in the ski area and provided a new, modern skiing experience. “With the new Aussichtsberg and Angeralm 6-seater chairlifts, Dachstein West has achieved a true vision for the future. These lifts are a visible sign that targeted investments in quality, safety, and guest comfort are having an immediate impact. The high level of guest satisfaction confirms that we are on the right track. Around €22 million was invested in the two new lifts. articles.content: Before heading off-piste, ski touring, snowshoeing, or entering uncontrolled terrain, checking the avalanche bulletin is not optional — it is one of the most important safety steps you can take. Yet many skiers and riders still look only at the danger number , without fully understanding how to use the rest of the information to plan a safe mountain day. This guide explains how to read and apply avalanche bulletins properly , what they can (and cannot) tell you, and where to find the official avalanche forecasts across Europe. What an Avalanche Bulletin Is — and What It Is Not An avalanche bulletin (or avalanche forecast) is a regional risk assessment , based on: snowpack observations recent avalanche activity weather patterns (snowfall, wind, temperature) terrain characteristics Swiss Avalanche Bulletin Update. articles.title: Georgia Man Dies In Skiing Accident at New York Ski Resort
articles.description: The investigation into the cause of death is ongoing.
articles.content: Tragic news out of New York State where a 44-year-old Georgia man died Wednesday after he was found in the treeline at Whiteface Mountain following a search conducted by ski patrol. New York State Police report Michael E. Vacek Jr. of Atlanta, Georgia, was reported missing at approximately 10:00am by friends he was skiing with. Whiteface Mountain Ski Patrol was notified that Vacek was missing after he failed to return while out on the mountain. Whiteface Mountain Ski Patrol launched a search and located Vacek in the treeline along the Upper/Lower Skyward Trail. A ski patrol supervisor was notified and Vacek was transported to the resort’s medical building where life-saving measures were continued by responding local fire and rescue departments. Vacek was pronounced dead at the scene. State police responded to the incident at approximately 1:03pm. The Essex County Coroner responded and transported the body to Glens Falls Hospital. articles.content: In March and April, the days grow longer and weather conditions become particularly favourable for skiing. It is the ideal time to enjoy the mountains and the slopes of Alta Badia, in the heart of the Dolomites, a UNESCO World Heritage site, where excellent snow quality and meticulously groomed slopes ensure a high-level experience even at the end of the season. articles.content: Late January – 1 February 2026 Over the past week, avalanche activity across the Alps has followed a clear and worrying pattern. From the Mont Blanc massif to the Queyras and across into the Swiss Valais, numerous skier-triggered and spontaneous avalanches point to a snowpack that remains structurally unstable , despite periods of fair weather and already-tracked slopes. Rather than isolated incidents, the reports collected since late January describe reactive slabs, remote triggers, and persistent weak layers affecting a wide range of aspects and elevations. Much of the recent instability is consistent with wind-loaded slabs and foehn-driven snow transport , which can rapidly overload weak layers and create large, reactive avalanche conditions. Further reading: Why Wind is one of the Most Dangerous Avalanches Triggers. Foehn Winds and Rising Avalanches in the Alps. articles.title: Flying A $10,000 FPV Drone Over Europe’s Deadliest Mountain
articles.description: Swiss cinematographer Noah Malin took his $10k FPV drone to the Matterhorn to shoot a commercial, flying all the way to the summit.
articles.content: The Matterhorn is among the deadliest mountains in the world, with more than 500 deaths on the mountain since 1865. Every year the mountain sees 8-10 deaths, with up to 3000 mountaineers attempting to summit the iconic peak. With a summit altitude of 14,692 feet, it theoretically shouldn’t be incredibly difficult to fly a drone to the summit. However, the concept of flying a $10,000 piece of equipment far beyond your reach seems pretty stressful. Swiss cinematographer Noah Malin took his $10k FPV drone to the Matterhorn to shoot a commercial. Because of the drone’s size, he had to walk up to the Hörnlihütte at 10,695 feet. This wasn’t the first time someone’s flown a drone to the summit of the iconic European peak, but the fact that this is a high-end piece of equipment with a very nice camera truly shines in the footage. articles.title: Vonn Claims Olympics is Still on the Cards
articles.description: Lindsey Vonn tore her ACL in a high speed downhill crash at a World Cup event in Crans-Montana last week. She has not ruled out taking part in next weekend's Olympic Downhill in Italy. NEW The post Vonn Claims Olympics is Still on the Cards appeared first on PlanetSKI .
articles.content: She says she is “very hopeful” she can compete at the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics. Ski racers have competed with torn ACL’s before and Vonn crucially doesn’t have swelling on the knee. The former Olympic champion said her knee feels “stable, strong and is not swollen” and she feels “confident” she will make the women’s downhill event in Cortina next Sunday. “This is obviously not what I hoped for. I have been working really hard to come into these Games in a much different position,” she said. “I know what my chances were before the crash and I know that my chances aren’t the same as it stands now, but I know there is still a chance. “As long as there is a chance, I’ll try. That’s where I am.” The four-time world champion retired from the sport in 2019 but made a stunning comeback in December 2024 following a partial replacement of her right knee. Lindsey Vonn set to race again She is currently top of the World Cup downhill standings, with two race wins and three more podium finishes

articles.content: Winter mountains offer some of the most rewarding experiences in the Alps — from skiing and ski touring to snowshoeing and cross-country skiing. They are also complex, constantly changing environments , where risks are not always obvious and are not limited to one activity. This guide provides a clear, practical overview of winter mountain safety , helping skiers, snowshoers and Nordic users better understand terrain, conditions and context . It is written for awareness — not blame — and is designed to be read alongside official safety advice and avalanche bulletins. 1. Winter mountain risk goes beyond marked pistes A common misconception is that avalanche danger only concerns off-piste or backcountry skiers.
